ca.mcgill.ecse211.navigation

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.navigation.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to drive the robot on the demo floor.

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
        This method makes the robot travel to the coordinates it received as arguments. The distance that needs to be traveled is calculated. The angle that the robot needs to turn is calculated in the turnTo method which is called. Rotates the robot to face the direction in which it needs to travel to. Then rotates the wheels the exact distance from the current position to using the move method.
        Parameters:
        x - (tiles): x coordinate of destination
        y - (tiles): y coordinate of destination

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        This method turns the robot from currentAngle to angle theta in the most efficient direction. Calculations are performed to ensure the robot is turning in the smallest possible angle.
        Parameters:
        theta: - angle at which to turn clockwise

      • rotate

        public void rotate(boolean clockwise,
                   int angle,
                   boolean wait)
        This method rotates the robot either clockwise or counter clockwise, for a specified angle.
        Parameters:
        clockwise: - a Boolean that if true signifies clockwise and if false signifies counter clockwise
        angle: - the angle that the robot should turn
        wait: - a Boolean that if true the robot should wait for the rotation to terminate before doing anything else.

      • move

        public void move(boolean leftMotor,
                 boolean rightMotor,
                 boolean forward,
                 boolean wait,
                 double distance,
                 int speed)
        This method moves the robot forwards for a specified distance. It is called in the travelTo method.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor: - a Boolean that if true signifies that the left motor should be used
        rightMotor: - a Boolean that if true signifies that the right motor should be used
        forward: - a Boolean that if true signifies that the robot should move forward, and if false the robot should move backwards
        wait: - if the robot should wait for the rotation to terminate before doing anything else.

      • stopMotors

        public void stopMotors()
        stops the motors at the same time.
